data.title: 键入缺少的字母，完成下面的文字
data.blankContent: In the late 19th and early 20th centuries, John Horace Round and Frederic William Maitland, both historians of medieval Britain, arrived at different conclusions as to the character of English society before the Norman Conquest in 1066. Round ____ that ____ Normans ____ brought ____ with ____ to England, ____ Maitland ____ that ____ fundamentals ____ already ____ place ____ Britain ____ 1066. The debate continues today, but a consensus is building: England before the Conquest had commendation, which embodied some of the personal elements in feudalism.
data.partBlankContent: In the late 19th and early 20th centuries, John Horace Round and Frederic William Maitland, both historians of medieval Britain, arrived at different conclusions as to the character of English society before the Norman Conquest in 1066. Round arg___ that t__ Normans h__ brought feud_____ with th__ to England, wh___ Maitland cont_____ that i__ fundamentals we__ already i_ place i_ Britain bef___ 1066. The debate continues today, but a consensus is building: England before the Conquest had commendation, which embodied some of the personal elements in feudalism.
data.fullContent: In the late 19th and early 20th centuries, John Horace Round and Frederic William Maitland, both historians of medieval Britain, arrived at different conclusions as to the character of English society before the Norman Conquest in 1066. Round argued that the Normans had brought feudalism with them to England, while Maitland contended that its fundamentals were already in place in Britain before 1066. The debate continues today, but a consensus is building: England before the Conquest had commendation, which embodied some of the personal elements in feudalism.
data.answer: 在19世纪末期和20世纪初，两位中世纪英国历史学家约翰·霍拉斯·朗德（John Horace Round）和弗雷德里克·威廉·梅特兰（Frederic William Maitland）都对1066年诺曼征服之前英国社会的特征得出了不同的结论。梅特兰（Maitland）争辩说，其基本面已经在1066年之前在英国存在。辩论一直持续到今天，但正在建立一种共识：征服者赞扬之前的英格兰，这体现了封建制度中的一些个人要素。
